meeting_annotations.speaker: Kristen Schell
meeting_annotations.transcript: I can comment on that. I was just going to comment on that and maybe share some results from a recent paper that we've published. If the technology is there why aren't we doing it. And one of the sad cases was the Petra Nova plant in Texas. They had been capturing carbon at the source but just this February they stopped doing it because the price of oil was too low. So they have all the technology in place and it's just sitting there. And one of the things that we found was that you need a credible revenue stream for your CO2. It can't just be sequestering it. You need the company to make some kind of money off of it.
